text: Is there a specific reason that HubL can't be used in the CSS and JS windows on the new Custom Modules? Right now we have to add css in `require_css` tags if we need to use HubL

I'm getting an error saying that I can't use the function "get_public_template_url()" in the beta design manager. I can't find documentation on what to replace it with. Can someone help me out? Thanks
We've seen this happen recently as well and would love to know the fix so we can implement.
Yes, that is disabled in the new IDE, what are you trying to do?
I'm upgrading an old module. I need to know what to replace it with so the module doesn't break
Basically, there isn't a replacement. Do you need to import that template?
it's doesn't actually have any dependents
You can replace it by connecting files directly to a module in the right sidebar
The reason is that both css and js only load once per-page no matter the number of module instances. As a result, dynamic content wouldn’t be loaded if we allowed for it.
Hi Jim, my guess is that the file wasn’t actually ‘deleted’ if you select the ‘View’ option above the left finder window and then select ‘Recently deleted files’ you may see the stylesheet there

In the page editor:
<https://spin.d.pr/6JSpJJ+>

This UI needs TLC.
Speaking of simple menu - how to do anchors to the current page using simple menu?
and add inline some ids to stuff you want to link to
